com.game.characters

Enum Creature.Stat

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Creature.Stat>
      • com.game.characters.Creature.Stat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Creature.Stat>
    Enclosing class:
    Creature

    public static enum Creature.Stat
extends java.lang.Enum<Creature.Stat>
    Enumeration of every STAT required by the system specification. Used to define any debuff effects, damage taken, total encumberance, etc of the player. Because these are used for two different, parallel arrays, definitions for both arrays will be included for the base (Base:) and the altered stats (Curr:)
    Author:
    taylor

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      DEFENSEVALUE
      Base: The total defense value of the creature given by armor only Curr: The total defense value of the creature given by armor and any spell or actions buffs
      ENCUMBERANCE
      Base: 0 Curr: The 'actual' amount of 'weight' a character's inventory has.
      EXPERIENCE
      Base: The total experience need to reach the next level Curr: The total amount of experience the player has at the moment
      HEALTHPOINTS
      Base: The maximum amount of health a player can have (with a full health bar) Recovery is given by the functions defined on page 15 Curr: The current health a player has.
      INTELLIGENCE
      Base: The underlying Intelligence attribute for the character, ranges from 0-100 and scales according to the player's type Curr: the intelligence stat used to determine the damage done when executing cast comands
      LEVEL
      Base: The current level of the Creature Curr: The current level of the Creature
      MAGICPOINTS
      Base: The maximum amount of magic points a player can have (with a full magic bar) Recovery is given by the functions defined on page 15 Curr: The current magic points a player has left.
      SPEED
      Base: The underlying Speed attribute for the character, ranges from 0-100 and scales according to the player's type Curr: the speed attribute for the character, affect movement speed and defense in combat
      STRENGTH
      Base: The underlying Strength attribute for the character, ranges from 0-100 and scales according to the player's type Curr: The strength stat used to determine the damage done when executing attack commands

      • STRENGTH

        public static final Creature.Stat STRENGTH
        Base: The underlying Strength attribute for the character, ranges from 0-100 and scales according to the player's type Curr: The strength stat used to determine the damage done when executing attack commands

      • HEALTHPOINTS

        public static final Creature.Stat HEALTHPOINTS
        Base: The maximum amount of health a player can have (with a full health bar) Recovery is given by the functions defined on page 15 Curr: The current health a player has. If this reaches 0, a player should be declared dead and respawn

      • MAGICPOINTS

        public static final Creature.Stat MAGICPOINTS
        Base: The maximum amount of magic points a player can have (with a full magic bar) Recovery is given by the functions defined on page 15 Curr: The current magic points a player has left. For each cast, it should deplete a specified amount of magic points.

      • ENCUMBERANCE

        public static final Creature.Stat ENCUMBERANCE
        Base: 0 Curr: The 'actual' amount of 'weight' a character's inventory has.
